ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I gained insights into analyzing film and I gained an understanding of the pre-production process, and how it would shift towards production.
I learnt a lot about writing structure, pre-production, preparing budgets, dramatic analyses

I further developed my writing skills.  I gained knowledge and an understanding of how to create a budget and schedule and how to collaborate and give feedback on my peers' projects. 
I learned a lot more about pre-production and am super excited to continue creating my thesis project!!

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: The course was in a tough spot in the spring due to Covid-19 making it difficult for the short films to be filmed. The course was incredibly strong in generating content and giving feedback on works in progress in the fall. In the spring, though, there was comparatively less to do. I enjoyed when we used the course time to analyze existing films and increase our shared cinema vocabulary.

Strengths:
-Jon is a fantastic professor and gives incredible feedback 
-very welcoming and open environment 
-small, engaged group of classmates 

Weaknesses
-it is a lot of work BUT it is the work needed to make a great film and so worth it.

Strengths- small class size allows for individual attention, but also great class collaboration.  The course is super engaging and fun.  The class is set up in a way that we are constantly thinking about (and improving) our senior projects.  

weaknesses- none, it was sometimes difficult over zoom but overall great.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: The course struggled a bit in the second semester with pandemic restrictions, as most students could not complete the short films due to Covid-19 regulations. In the fall, the course worked well in the Zoom format.
Luckily this was my pre-production semester of advanced so it could function online because most of the work was script analysis and creation

The class worked pretty well over zoom.  Since our class is so small, zoom didn't detract much.  I would have loved to be in person for collaboration reasons, but Professor Andrews did a good job adapting to zoom.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Yes! Especially in an in-person year, I think the course offers an amazing opportunity to learn how to write a short film, and then produce it.

Absolutely!! Jon is the only reason Im a film major and the only professor on the actual filmmaking track. Its helped me create my dream project and the support is invaluable. I cant wait to be back in the class in the fall

Yes, definitely!! It is an excellent choice for the senior project for the film major.  It is hard work, but worth the challenge.  Jon Andrews is wonderful and this class is set up to be both engaging and collaborative!!  I'm excited about the next half of the class!

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
